newsitem.title: INDIA: India raises royalty rates on crude oil - PTI.
newsitem.headline: India raises royalty rates on crude oil - PTI.

text.p: India will increase royalty rates on crude oil which domestic oil companies pay to state governments to 578 rupees a tonne from 528 rupees, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said on Thursday.
The news agency said the proposal was cleared by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs.

The increase royalties was likely to directly affect the cost of production of crude by domestic oil companies such as ONGC Ltd and Oil India Ltd, and would push India's oil pool deficit even higher, PTI said.

India's oil pool deficit, the amount reimbursed by the government to oil companies to make up for subsidised prices, is expected to touch 155 billion rupees in the year ending March 31, 1997, against 57 billion rupees in 1995/96.
